Image_rotation_cnn package¶

Submodules¶

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_database module¶

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_function module¶

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_functions.image_read(file: str) → numpy.ndarray¶

Reads a single image into a numpy array using OpenCV :param file: path to the image :type img: str :return: Image array :rtype: np.ndarray

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_functions.prepare_1_image(file: str, filename: str, out_folder: str)¶

Resizes an image and rotate it 3 times to get 4 images that can be used to train the model.

Parameters

  • file (str) – path to the original image

  • filename (str) – filename base of the 4 processed images

  • out_folder (str) – path to the folder to upload the 4 processed images

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_functions.prepare_training_images(in_folder: str, out_folder: str) → tuple[int, list[str]]¶

Uses all image files in a folder to get 4 images / file that can be used to train the model. The N images in the original folder must all be in the normal orientation. The 4xN processed images in the output folder are squared with size 180 and rotated in 4 orientations (0, 90, 180, and 270 degrees). The last 3 characters of the file names indicates the orientation : ‘000’, ‘090’, ‘180’ or ‘270’.

Parameters

  • in_folder (str) – path to the folder with original images

  • out_folder (str) – path to the folder to upload the processed images

Returns

a Tuple with the number of images uploaded and a List of the files that were not processed

Return type

(int, List of str)

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_functions.resize_and_pad(img: numpy.ndarray, desired_size: int = 180) → numpy.ndarray¶

Resizes an image to a square image of the desired size, with a black pad.

Parameters

  • img (np.ndarray) – Image array

  • desired_size (int, optional) – Final image size, defaults to 180

Returns

Resized image array

Return type

np.ndarray

Image_rotation_cnn.prepare_functions.rotate_image(img: numpy.ndarray, angle: int = 90) → numpy.ndarray¶

Rotates an image with the desired angle.

Parameters

  • img (np.ndarray) – Image array

  • angle (int, optional) – Angle of rotation in degrees, defaults to 90

Returns

Rotated image array

Return type

np.ndarray
